captions.text: - My friends, we've just set up a new speed record at 1 mile!
- What's that Dimitry?
- I clearly remember when 3 years ago
Young man, looking just like you
was getting out of the similar black Lamborghini
with a face like...well, yeah... "they overdrive me"
now 2-3 years later...
- Nothing changed, the same black Lamborghini.
- Yeah, but now it's a winner...
- Looks like it was a record ride...
a mile in 23.8 sec!
and 387 km/h - a record on 1 mile!!!
- No seriously!
- You just did Pleshakov... fu..ing good!
- Yeah, did it.
- Champion! And a new record for Russia
- yeah man... Great job
- How was that Egor, did you throw up?
- You'll see, there will be one place, where even I throw up
- Maaan, you did it right! You are the champ of Russia
I thought the record will stay for like 3 years at least.
The speed is incredible!
- Soon, there will be as much Lambs as GTR's
- Did we made it fast in her?
- Dima, no one's gonna break this record!
- Absolute Russian record
and absolute Unlim 500+ record
Of all time
Dmitry Samorukov
He also broke the speed record
405 km/h
just think about this numbers!
Thank you my friends, see you here next time!

title: Lamborghini Gallardo UR Twin Turbo Top Speed 405 kmh (251 mph)

comments.author: redman147

comments.text:
+Luis Gomez The laws of physics says that clown.

When it comes to acceleration weight does indeed play a part because of 
inertia. F = ma   Force = mass times acceleration. It's therefore clear 
that a given force produces more acceleration for less weight and vice 
versa.

For top speed however the main force to be overcome is *aerodynamic* *drag* 
.  Aerodynamic drag increases squarely, and the force required to overcome 
this increases cubely. This means that twice the speeds requires 8 times 
the power. Three times the speed 27 times the power and four times the 
speed 64 times the power.  The only way to makes this force smaller is to 
design a more slippery car, as in more aerodynamically efficient. You need 
lots of horsepower to overcome aerodynamic drag.

So yes, at 400km/h you're going to need a hell of a lot of power. Weight is 
*not* a factor in the equation for aerodynamic drag. Check it out yourself. 

If you seriously believe a guy less is going to make a car go faster at a 
speed in which the force from the drag is insanely high you're truly daft. 

Weight plays a negligible part, solely from friction, which compared to the 
aerodynamic drag is miniscule.
comments.author: Voight-Kampff Tester

comments.text:
+Luis Gomez At 1700+ hp, it's gearing and aerodynamics that dictate top 
speed.
